benchmark_details.name: MuChin (Chinese Colloquial Music Description Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: MuChin is the first open-source benchmark designed to evaluate the performance of multimodal large language models in understanding and describing music in Chinese colloquial language. It employs a robust annotation platform to ensure high-precision and popular semantic alignment.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To establish a benchmark for evaluating language models on their ability to generate and understand descriptions of music, particularly from a colloquial perspective.

data.annotation: Multi-person, multi-stage quality assurance process involving both amateur and professional annotators.

methodology.calculation: Scores are calculated based on the similarity of generated lyrics to ground truth across various dimensions including song structure, section similarity, and rhyme matching.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment and quality of generated music descriptions compared to human annotations.
methodology.validation: Results validated through a multi-tiered quality assurance process involving professional annotators and system checks.
